Question: The same year, this person was honored with the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award.
Hints: The ____ band and quartet took over the stage and performed the numbers that had already made them famous.
This person learned quickly, becoming a strong player at an early age: he was soon playing professionally in various bands.
In 1949, when he was 40, this person decided to study with Reginald Kell, one of the world's leading classical clarinetists.
